text: {"data":{"codelists":[{"annotations":[{"id":"origin","value":"INTEGRATION"},{"id":"isFinal"},{"id":"lastUpdatedAt","value":"2025-10-15T22:08:42.207925Z"}],"id":"CL_WHDREO_INDICATOR","name":"Western Hemisphere Regional Economic Outlook (WHDREO) Indicator","names":{"en":"Western Hemisphere Regional Economic Outlook (WHDREO) Indicator"},"descriptions":{},"version":"5.0.0","agencyID":"IMF.WHD","isPartial":false,"codes":[{"annotations":[],"id":"BCA_GDP_BP6","name":"Current account balance (credit less debit), Percent of GDP","names":{"en":"Current account balance (credit less debit), Percent of GDP"},"description":"The current account balance is the balance of current transactions (transactions in goods and services, earned income and transfer income) between residents and non-residents. The term current account balance is used in the external accounts and is expressed from the perspective of resident units. The term current external balance is used in the national accounts and is expressed from the perspective of the non-resident units, and therefore with the opposite sign.  Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"The current account balance is the balance of current transactions (transactions in goods and services, earned income and transfer income) between residents and non-residents. The term current account balance is used in the external accounts and is expressed from the perspective of resident units. The term current external balance is used in the national accounts and is expressed from the perspective of the non-resident units, and therefore with the opposite sign.  Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GGXGGEI_GDP","name":"Primary expenditure (expenditure less interest payable), General government, Percent of GDP","names":{"en":"Primary expenditure (expenditure less interest payable), General government, Percent of GDP"},"description":"The government's total expenditure excluding interest payments on debt. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"The government's total expenditure excluding interest payments on debt. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GGXONLB_GDP","name":"Primary net lending (+) / net borrowing (-), General government, Percent of GDP","names":{"en":"Primary net lending (+) / net borrowing (-), General government, Percent of GDP"},"description":"Primary net lending/borrowing refers to the difference between a government's total revenue (excluding borrowing) and its total expenditures (excluding debt repayments and interest payments). It represents the government's fiscal position, indicating whether it is running a surplus (positive value) or a deficit (negative value) before considering the impact of debt servicing costs.  Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"Primary net lending/borrowing refers to the difference between a government's total revenue (excluding borrowing) and its total expenditures (excluding debt repayments and interest payments). It represents the government's fiscal position, indicating whether it is running a surplus (positive value) or a deficit (negative value) before considering the impact of debt servicing costs.  Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"GGXWDG_GDP","name":"Gross debt, General government, Percent of GDP","names":{"en":"Gross debt, General government, Percent of GDP"},"description":"Gross debt is the sum of all liabilities that are debt instruments.  Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.  Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"Gross debt is the sum of all liabilities that are debt instruments.  Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.  Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Value expressed as a percent of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of a country. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"NGDP_RPCH","name":"Gross domestic product (GDP), Constant prices, Percent","names":{"en":"Gross domestic product (GDP), Constant prices, Percent"},"description":"Gross domestic product reflects the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using either the expenditure approach, the income approach, or the production approach.  Prices that have been adjusted to a reference base year to remove the effects of inflation, allowing for meaningful comparison of the purchasing power of money over time. This reflects the real value of goods and services, as opposed to their nominal value (current prices), which can be distorted by inflation. The percent change between the data points at the end of two consecutive years. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"Gross domestic product reflects the total income earned through the production of goods and services in an economic territory during an accounting period. It can be measured in three different ways: using either the expenditure approach, the income approach, or the production approach.  Prices that have been adjusted to a reference base year to remove the effects of inflation, allowing for meaningful comparison of the purchasing power of money over time. This reflects the real value of goods and services, as opposed to their nominal value (current prices), which can be distorted by inflation. The percent change between the data points at the end of two consecutive years. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"PCPIE_PCH","name":"All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), End-of-period (EoP), percent change","names":{"en":"All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), End-of-period (EoP), percent change"},"description":"All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This focuses on the change between the value at the beginning of a period and the value at the end of that period. The period could be a day, month, quarter, year, etc. This is often used to track changes in financial or economic indicators over specific periods. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This focuses on the change between the value at the beginning of a period and the value at the end of that period. The period could be a day, month, quarter, year, etc. This is often used to track changes in financial or economic indicators over specific periods. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}}],"codelistExtensions":[]}]},"meta":{"schema":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sdmx-twg/sdmx-json/master/metadata-message/tools/schemas/2.0.0/sdmx-json-metadata-schema.json","id":"IDREF5616","test":false,"prepared":"2025-11-09T20:55:26.384821739Z","contentLanguages":["en"],"sender":{"id":"unknown"}}}
